synopsis: Creates the required files and configuration (sometimes referred to as scaffolding) for a Python Django application.
notes: This example adds the required files and configuration for new web role to the current application, using the name â€œMyWebRoleâ€ with a role instance count of 2.

examples.title: 1: Add a web role using default values
examples.remarks: This example adds the required files and configuration for new web role using the default values of a service named WebRole1 with 1 instance.

examples.title: 2: Add a web role using default values
examples.remarks: This example adds the required files and configuration for new web role using the default values of a service named WebRole1 with 1 instance.

examples.title: 3: Single Instance Web Role
examples.remarks: <Iâ€™d cut this one, since the previous example included this by default, and the next one shows multiple instances>

examples.title: 4: Add a web role with multiple instances
examples.remarks: This example adds the required files and configuration for a new web role to the current application, using the name "MyWebRole" and a role instance count of 2.

parameters.name: Instances
parameters.description: Specifies the number of role instances for this web role. The default is 1.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: Specifies the name of the web role. The name determines the name of the directory that contains the required files and configuration for the Python Django application. The default is WebRole#, where # is the number of web roles in the service.

name: Add-AzureDjangoWebRole
description:
This topic describes the cmdlet in the 0.8.10 version of the Microsoft Azure PowerShell module. To get the version of the module you're using, in the Azure PowerShell console, type (Get-Module -Name Azure).Version.
Creates the required files and configuration (sometimes referred to as scaffolding) for a Python Django application that will be hosted in Azure through IIS.
